question.questionA: Female cones berry-like; ovuliferous scales fleshy; seeds not winged
question.questionB: Females cones woody, ovuliferous scales peltate; seeds winged

question.questionA: Leaves sharp-pointed, needle-like, more than 5 mm long, with two white  stomatal  groves on the adaxial surface; female cones yellow turning reddish brown when ripe.
question.questionB: Leaves  blunt,  scale-like,  less than 2 mm long, lacking prominent stomatal  groves; female cones black turning yellow-green and finally dark red

question.questionA: Shoots rounded or quadrangular; female cones 3-4  cm;  seeds  narrowly winged, six to twenty on each scale.
question.questionB: Shoots flattened; female cones c. 2 cm; seeds broadly winged; up to five on each scale
